title: Configure Mandatory Access Control with AppArmor
rationale: AppArmor provides mandatory access control (MAC) that restricts programs capabilities based on per-program profiles. This implements defense-in-depth by limiting what applications can access, even if compromised.
evidence_notes: Verified AppArmor profiles loaded and enforcing via aa-status output showing all profiles in enforce mode. Tested profile enforcement by attempting restricted file access.

title: Implement Automated Security Updates
rationale: Automated security updates ensure critical vulnerabilities are patched promptly without manual intervention. This reduces the window of exposure to known exploits while maintaining system stability through tested security updates.
evidence_notes: Confirmed unattended-upgrades service active via systemctl status. Reviewed /var/log/unattended-upgrades/unattended-upgrades.log showing successful automatic patch installations.

title: Harden SSH Configuration
rationale: SSH hardening prevents brute-force attacks and unauthorized access by disabling root login and password authentication. Key-based authentication provides stronger security through cryptographic verification.
evidence_notes: Validated SSH configuration with "sshd -T" command. Tested authentication methods by confirming password authentication rejected and only SSH key access permitted.

title: Configure UFW Firewall with Default Deny
rationale: Uncomplicated Firewall (UFW) implements network-level access control following principle of least privilege. Default deny stance blocks all unauthorized inbound connections while allowing necessary services.
evidence_notes: Confirmed firewall rules active via "ufw status verbose". Tested ruleset by scanning with nmap from external host, verified only SSH port accessible.

title: Enable and Configure Auditd
rationale: Auditd provides detailed logging of security-relevant events including file access, system calls, and authentication attempts. This creates an audit trail essential for forensics and compliance requirements.
evidence_notes: Verified auditd service running and rules loaded via "auditctl -l". Generated test events and confirmed logs appearing in /var/log/audit/audit.log with proper tagging.

title: Implement File Integrity Monitoring with AIDE
rationale: AIDE (Advanced Intrusion Detection Environment) creates cryptographic checksums of critical system files to detect unauthorized modifications. This provides early warning of system compromise or configuration tampering.
evidence_notes: Initialized AIDE database covering /bin, /sbin, /etc directories. Executed test check with "aide --check" confirming baseline established and change detection operational.

title: Disable Unnecessary Services and Ports
rationale: Reducing attack surface by disabling unused services eliminates potential entry points for attackers. Each running service represents code that could contain vulnerabilities or be misconfigured.
evidence_notes: Reviewed enabled services via systemctl output. Confirmed CUPS printing and Avahi mDNS services disabled and not listening on network interfaces via netstat.

title: Configure Kernel Security Parameters
rationale: Kernel parameter hardening restricts access to sensitive system information and prevents information disclosure that aids attackers. These settings make exploitation more difficult by limiting kernel visibility.
evidence_notes: Applied sysctl settings and verified persistence across reboot. Confirmed restricted dmesg access as non-root user and kernel pointer obfuscation via /proc/sys checks.

title: Implement Password Policies with PAM
rationale: Strong password policies enforced through PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules) prevent weak passwords that are susceptible to brute-force attacks. Complexity requirements ensure passwords meet minimum security standards.
evidence_notes: Updated pwquality configuration with 14-character minimum and complexity requirements. Tested enforcement by attempting weak password changes, confirmed policy rejection.

title: Configure Fail2Ban Intrusion Prevention
rationale: Fail2Ban monitors log files for malicious activity patterns and automatically blocks attacking IP addresses. This provides active defense against brute-force attacks and automated scanning attempts.
evidence_notes: Enabled SSH jail with 5-attempt limit and 10-minute ban period. Validated by triggering failed authentication attempts, confirmed IP blocking via "fail2ban-client status sshd".

title: Initialize React TypeScript Project with Vite
rationale: Vite provides fast development experience with Hot Module Replacement and optimized production builds. TypeScript adds type safety that prevents runtime errors and improves code maintainability for professional portfolio presentation.
evidence_notes: Verified Vite dev server running with HMR functional. Confirmed TypeScript compilation working without errors via npm run build.

title: Configure Tailwind CSS for Styling
rationale: Tailwind CSS enables rapid UI development with utility-first approach while maintaining consistent design system. This creates professional, responsive layouts without custom CSS overhead.
evidence_notes: Tested Tailwind classes rendering correctly. Confirmed production build tree-shaking removes unused styles, validating optimal bundle size.

title: Set Up Supabase Database Integration
rationale: Supabase provides PostgreSQL database with real-time capabilities and built-in authentication. This enables dynamic content management for projects and documentation without backend infrastructure.
evidence_notes: Validated Supabase client connection with test query. Confirmed environment variables loaded correctly and API calls returning expected data.

title: Design Database Schema with RLS Policies
commands: CREATE TABLE projects with id, title, description, tech_stack, security_features
CREATE TABLE project_documentation_steps with project_id foreign key
ALTER TABLE projects ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY
rationale: Proper database schema design with normalized tables enables flexible content management. Row Level Security policies ensure data access control even though portfolio is public-facing.
evidence_notes: Executed schema migrations successfully. Verified foreign key constraints and RLS policies active via Supabase dashboard.

title: Build Reusable React Components
commands: Create Projects.tsx with card grid layout
rationale: Component-based architecture promotes code reuse and maintainability. Each component has single responsibility making debugging and updates straightforward.
evidence_notes: Tested component isolation and prop passing. Confirmed proper TypeScript interfaces prevent prop mismatches and improve developer experience.

title: Implement Responsive Design
commands: Use Tailwind responsive prefixes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:)
Test layouts at mobile (375px), tablet (768px), desktop (1440px)
Add CSS Grid for project cards with auto-fit minmax
rationale: Responsive design ensures portfolio displays correctly across all devices. Mobile-first approach prioritizes performance and usability on constrained devices while progressively enhancing for larger screens.
evidence_notes: Validated responsive breakpoints using browser DevTools. Tested navigation, card layouts, and typography scaling across device sizes.

title: Optimize Performance and Build
rationale: Production optimization reduces load times and improves user experience. Build analysis identifies large dependencies and opportunities for code splitting.
evidence_notes: Confirmed production build completes without errors. Validated output bundle sizes reasonable with proper tree-shaking of unused Tailwind classes.

title: Project Overview: Learning-First SOC Lab
commands: Host System: Dell XPS 9320 (Intel i7-1260P, 32GB RAM, 1TB NVMe)
Hypervisor: KVM/QEMU with virt-manager on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS
Management Philosophy: Change-control discipline with documented baselines
Current Status: Phase 1 & 1A COMPLETE - Wazuh infrastructure operational and validated
rationale: This is a learning-first project designed to demonstrate hands-on implementation of enterprise security infrastructure. The approach emphasizes methodical baseline documentation before expansion - deliberately pausing after each validated phase rather than rushing to deploy everything at once. This mirrors real-world SOC operations where stability and documentation take precedence over feature velocity.
evidence_notes: Phase 1 and Phase 1A are complete and operational. All subsequent phases (agent deployment, integration, monitoring) are intentionally deferred to preserve a stable, documented baseline. The environment is designed for learning SOC analyst skills including SIEM operation, log analysis, and security event correlation.

title: Network Architecture Baseline
commands: Network Isolation: Separate VLANs for management vs monitored systems
rationale: The network architecture implements defense-in-depth with isolated management infrastructure. The Wazuh Manager resides on a hardened management network (192.168.100.0/24) separate from production endpoints. This design mirrors enterprise SOC deployments where security infrastructure is isolated from monitored systems.
evidence_notes: Network architecture documented and validated. Management network secured with restrictive firewall rules. Wazuh Manager deployed on isolated subnet with controlled access. Architecture designed for future expansion with additional sensors, agents, and security tools.

title: Phase 1: Deploy Wazuh Infrastructure (COMPLETED)
rationale: Wazuh all-in-one installation provides the complete SIEM stack: Manager (analysis engine), Indexer (data storage/search), and Dashboard (visualization interface). This deployment establishes the foundational security monitoring platform for the entire SOC lab.
evidence_notes: COMPLETED AND VALIDATED: Wazuh Manager, Indexer, and Dashboard successfully deployed and operational. Services confirmed running. Dashboard accessible at https://192.168.100.10. Admin credentials secured. All components healthy and responding.

title: Phase 1A: Initialize Security & Validate Baseline (COMPLETED)
commands: Secure admin credentials in password manager
Confirm all services operational and logging
rationale: Security initialization establishes the hardened baseline before any expansion. This phase extracts and secures credentials, validates encrypted communications, and confirms all components are operational. Most critically, it documents the known-good baseline state - a snapshot of working infrastructure before adding complexity.
evidence_notes: COMPLETED AND VALIDATED: Security credentials extracted and secured. Dashboard authentication verified with strong passwords. HTTPS confirmed operational. All services logging correctly. Baseline state documented. This represents a stable, validated checkpoint before agent deployment.

Verify agent registration and connectivity in Wazuh Dashboard
rationale: Windows agent deployment extends monitoring to endpoints. Agents collect security events, system logs, and file changes from Windows systems. This phase enables visibility into endpoint activities - the foundation for threat detection and incident response.
evidence_notes: STATUS: INTENTIONALLY DEFERRED. Not yet implemented to preserve validated baseline. Will deploy agents only after baseline is fully documented and backup procedures established. This disciplined approach prevents rushing into expansion before the foundation is solid.

rationale: Sysmon provides deep Windows system telemetry including process creation, network connections, and file operations. Integration with Wazuh enables advanced threat hunting and forensic analysis capabilities critical for detecting sophisticated attacks.
